Key Match Events: Fred VanVleet grabbed a key steal late to allow the Houston Rockets to hold on for a 119-115 win over the Los Angeles Lakers
Amen Thompson added 23 points and a career-high 16 rebounds in his return after a two-game suspension
LeBron James got the Lakers within 117-115 with eight seconds to go
Alperen Sengun missed 1 of 2 free throws after that to give Los Angeles a chance to tie it
Fred VanVleet stole the inbounds pass intended for James while the Lakers star was signaling for a timeout
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James addressed the referees not acknowledging his call for a timeout after the game
James told reporters, 'Max definitely still had the ball in his hands but it wasn't awarded, That happens. We didn't lose the game because of that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets had 52 points in the paint to 40 by the Lakers
The Lakers visit Dallas on Tuesday night and the Rockets visit Washington that night
Others: LeBron James struggled to get going early and had just five points at halftime
Anthony Davis had 30 points and 13 rebounds for the Lakers
James added 21 points, 13 rebounds and nine assists
The second-year player Amen Thompson is starting in place of Jabari Smith Jr., who could be out up to two months after breaking a bone in his hand Friday
